intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum var. sylvaticum, commonly known as the meadow chrysanthemum, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy tissue. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with white petals surrounding a yellow central disc, blooming from late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated, and covered in a soft, downy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
